summary: The concept of "carpet" within the EU legal and regulatory framework scrutinizes various aspects of the leather and textile industries. This includes regulations on the production and sale of tufted carpets, which are significant coverings in both residential and commercial spaces. The EU aims to bolster consumer protection by insisting on standards that ensure carpets are safe and environmentally friendly. Regularizations may include the origins of materials used, with a focus on sustainable practices. By channelling resources towards innovative production methods, the industry can regain competitiveness. Furthermore, the EU supports initiatives that favouring underemployment reduction in regions like Jamaica, thereby promoting social responsibility.
